headline: AI Processor Market Valuation Set to Skyrocket to US$ 323.8 Billion by 2033 | Astute Analytica

headline: Axiado raises $100 million for chip to save space, power in AI data centers
summary: Axiado, a Silicon Valley-based startup that is making a chip designed to ​save space and power in artificial intelligence servers, said on Tuesday it has ‌raised $100 million in fresh capital.  Inside AI data centers, thousands of powerful servers must work together in concert to ‌train models.  Doing so requires coordination over an internal network, and all servers contain a handful of chips whose job it is to handle those instructions and manage the server's circuit board while keeping it secure from hackers.

content.title: Axiado raises $100 million for chip to save space, power in AI data centers

Doing so requires coordination over an internal network, and all servers contain a handful of chips whose job it is to handle those instructions and manage the server's circuit board while keeping it secure from hackers.

headline: HPE accelerates AI deployments with first AMD "Helios" AI rack-scale architecture with open, scale-up networking built with Broadcom
summary: BARCELONA, December 02, 2025--HPE Discover Barcelona 2025 – HPE (NYSE:HPE) today announced it is speeding up deployment of at-scale artificial intelligence (AI) training and inferencing for cloud service providers (CSPs), including neoclouds, by offering the first AMD "Helios" AI rack-scale architecture with integrated scale-up Ethernet networking. The solution, leveraging purpose-built HPE Juniper Networking hardware and software along with Broadcom’s Tomahawk 6 networking chip, is based on the

headline: World's largest stablecoin issuer enters AI race with new LLM push

Announced on Dec. 2, the system allows full LLM execution, LoRA training and instruction-tuning directly on laptops, desktops, consumer GPUs, and even ...

headline: Vultr to invest $1 billion in Ohio AI cluster using AMD chips
summary: Cloud infrastructure company Vultr said on Tuesday it would invest more than $1 billion to launch a ​new artificial intelligence cluster powered by Advanced Micro Devices' processors at a ‌new data center in Springfield, Ohio.  The new cluster is a 50-megawatt, 24,000-chip facility ‌that will deploy AMD's Instinct MI355X graphics processing units, which will be interconnected with ethernet-based fabric that improves data transfer speed and traffic flow.  Vultr is trying to benefit from the AI boom by positioning itself as a cost-effective alternative to hyperscalers, ⁠offering computing at lower prices.‌ Vultr CEO J.J. Kardwell said that its cloud infrastructure services are typically half the price of what hyperscalers charge.

content.title: Vultr to invest $1 billion in Ohio AI cluster using AMD chips
content.summary: Cloud infrastructure company Vultr said on Tuesday it would invest more than $1 billion to launch a ​new artificial intelligence cluster powered by Advanced Micro Devices' processors at a ‌new data center in Springfield, Ohio.  The new cluster is a 50-megawatt, 24,000-chip facility ‌that will deploy AMD's Instinct MI355X graphics processing units, which will be interconnected with ethernet-based fabric that improves data transfer speed and traffic flow.  Vultr is trying to benefit from the AI boom by positioning itself as a cost-effective alternative to hyperscalers, ⁠offering computing at lower prices.‌ Vultr CEO J.J. Kardwell said that its cloud infrastructure services are typically half the price of what hyperscalers charge.
